DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Never had quantities of regulated substances beyond TQs.

_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: All SRVs are plumbed to an exterior 10,000 gallon water tank to absorb any potential releases to prevent them from contaminating the atmosphere.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Harding & Leggett, Inc.
700 Center Street, Orange Cove CA, 93646

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Harding & Leggett, Inc. is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment at our facility. 

It is our policy to ensure that controls are in place to prevent possible releases of ammonia. If such a release does occur, our emergency response personnel are trained to control and mitigate the effects of the release. We are completely coordinated with the Orange Cove Fire Department, who provide additional emergency response expertise. 

The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled 
Harding & Leggett, Inc.' primary activities at our facility located at 700 Center Street in Orange Cove CA are the grading, packing, and shipping of citrus products. Anhydrous ammonia is our only regulated substance, and is used to provide refrigeration for our products. 

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps 
Our facility is in full compliance with the EPA's accidental release prevention requirements as defined in 40 CFR Part 68, the requirements for the California Accidental Release Prevention program (CalARP), the OSHA PSM requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119, and the EPCRA Section 302 notification requirements. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that are in place at our Orange Cove CA plant, located at 700 Center Street.

Process Safety Information 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. maintains a detailed record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment specifications associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment and process.  Most of this

documentation is in the form of Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) manuals, housed in the office of the Cold Storage Manager at 700 Center Street, Orange Cove CA, 93646. 

Process Hazards Analysis 
Our facility has conducted a comprehensive study to ensure that hazards associated with our ammonia system is identified and effectively controlled. Te chosen method for this Process Hazard Analysis was ¿What-If¿. This study was undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations, and will be revalidated at least every five years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner. 

Operating Procedures 
To further ensure that activities are safely conducted in our ammonia system, Harding & Leggett, Inc. has developed written operating procedures to supplement our current on-the-job operator training. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operation, normal shutdown and startup, and emergency shutdown and startup. This information is regularly reviewed and readily accessible to operators involved in the processes. 
 

Training 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. has an on-the-job training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating process equipment are competent in the operating procedures associated with this equipment. Written procedures are used to enhance the on-the-job training. Refresher training is provided at least every three years. Documentation of all training is held in our main office at 700 Center Street, Orange Cove CA, 93646. 

 
Mechanical Integrity 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. has a written maintenance program in place for preventative maintenance of all ammonia equipment to ensure continuing reliable and safe operation. Equipment maintained under this program includes: Pressure vessels; Piping systems; Relief and vent systems; Emergency shutdown systems; Controls; Compressors; and Pumps. This maintenance is completed o

nly by qualified personnel with training in maintenance practices. Specialized training is provided as needed to ensure maintenance personnel are fully qualified. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner. 

Management of Change 
Written procedures are followed at Harding & Leggett, Inc. to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures. This ensures that process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification. 

Pre-startup Reviews 
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes will be conducted as a regular practice at Harding & Leggett, Inc. It is our goal to ensure that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing new or re-conditioned equipment into operation. 

Compliance Audits 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. will conduct audits on a regular basis to verify that the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented. These audits will be carried out at least every 3 years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits will be undertaken in a safe and prompt manner. 

Incident Investigation 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. will promptly investigate any incident that has resulted in, or could have resulted in the release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from occurring under similar situations. All reports will be retained for a minimum of 5 years. 

Employee Participation 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort and has developed a written plan to implement this philosophy. Company emp

loyees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP rule, particularly information resulting from process hazard analyses. 

Contractor Safety 
On occasion, our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance will be carried out. Harding & Leggett, Inc. has a strict policy of informing the contractors of any known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes within our facility. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur. 

 
Five-year Accident History 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. has had a good record of preventing accidental releases. No incidents have occurred over the last 5 years. 

Emergency Response Plan 
Harding & Leggett, Inc. has developed a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas. 

To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response. 

Harding & Leggett, Inc. coordinates its emergency response plan with the Region 5 LEPC and the Dinuba Fire Department. 

Planned Changes to Improve Safety 
The following changes are planned or are already underway to improve the level of safety within our plant. These include: 
-	Re-validatio

n of our written Standard Operating Procedures
-	Re-validation of our written Maintenance Procedures
-	Additional training for facility employees
-	Label all piping and valves
